subject: Relationships
subcategory: Famous Love Stories That Changed History
title: The Loving Marriage That Changed American Law
description: Learn The Loving Marriage That Changed American Law in one minute.

hook.text: Richard and Mildred Loving just wanted to live in Virginia. The state said their marriage was a crime.

buildup.text: Richard was white; Mildred was Black. In 1958 Virginia, their marriage violated anti-miscegenation laws.

discovery.text: They were arrested in their bedroom at night. A judge gave them a choice: prison or leave Virginia for 25 years.

twist.text: Mildred wrote to Robert Kennedy, who referred her to the ACLU. Their case reached the Supreme Court.

climax.text: In 1967, Loving v. Virginia struck down all racial marriage bans. Their quiet love changed law for millions.

punchline.text: The Lovings fought for their marriage. The Supreme Court agreed: love wins.

quiz.question: What did the Loving v. Virginia case accomplish?
options: Struck down all racial marriage bans in the US
